---
layout:         post-mbed-org
title:          "mbed at Make: Tokyo Meeting 07!"
date:           2011-12-15T12:02:19.000Z
author:         Simon Ford
tags:           
originalUrl:    https://developer.mbed.org/blog/entry/mbed-at-Make-Tokyo-Meeting-07/
---

<p>O&apos;Reilly Japan held <a href="http://jp.makezine.com/blog/2011/12/mtm07_thankyou.html"
  rel="nofollow">Make: Tokyo Meeting 07 (MTM07)</a>) at the Tokyo Institute
  of Technology in the Meguro district on 3rd and 4th December 2011. Makers
  exhibited, performed, and offered workshops over a weekend to showcase
  and inspire others with their development projects.</p>
<p><span><span class="authortext"><a href="/users/okano/"><img alt="" class="icon" src="data:image/jpeg;base64,"></a> <a href="/users/okano/"> Tedd OKANO</a></span></span>was
  there and has written a great summary for those who weren&apos;t lucky
  enough to experience it...See how many mbed&apos;s you can spot!</p>
<table>
  <tr>
    <td>
      <div class="flex-video">
        <iframe width="420" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/E5jiFoIwYP4"
        frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe>
      </div>
    </td>
    <td>
      <img width="360" alt="360" title="360" src="https://developer.mbed.org/media/uploads/simon/360xNx_scaled_tokyo_institute_of_tech.jpg.pagespeed.ic.hRRUVZO8ur.jpg">
    </td>
  </tr>
</table>
<p>So many people were there! It was very crowded and I didn&apos;t have
  enough time to see details of every exhibit but I found the mbed is getting
  more popular for the Makers. Most of applications which have microcontrollers
  are using mbed and Arduino. Those two MCU modules are dominant in this
  world.</p>
<p>A big news for mbed was new &quot;yellow&quot; mbed. <span><span class="authortext"><a href="/users/logic_star/"><img alt="" class="icon" src="data:image/jpeg;base64,"></a> <a href="/users/logic_star/"> logic star</a></span></span>(GPS
  Labo) was demonstrating the <a href="/handbok/mbed-NXP-LPC11U24">mbed LPC11U24</a>.</p>
<p>
  <img src="https://developer.mbed.org/media/uploads/simon/yellow_mbed.jpg"
  alt="/media/uploads/simon/yellow_mbed.jpg" title="/media/uploads/simon/yellow_mbed.jpg">
</p>
<p>The demo was called &quot;Energy Harvesting&quot;. The news mbed can be
  operated 3 years with small solar cell and batteries. New mbed&#x2019;s
  outstanding energy efficiency was giving people a strong impression. In
  MTM07, the <a href="/handbook/mbed-NXP-LPC1768">mbed LPC1768</a> could be
  seen many places. And there were LPCXpresso boards too. Some of them explained
  those LPCXpresso boards were using binary which was build on mbed online
  compiler!</p>
<p>Another big news was a mbed/LPCXpresso baseboard <a href="http://mbed.org/users/techand/notebook/blackone-new-boad-with-xbee-graphiclcd/">&quot;Black One&quot;</a> was
  launched in MTM07 by <span><span class="authortext"><a href="/users/techand/"><img alt="" class="icon" src="data:image/jpeg;base64,"></a> <a href="/users/techand/"> Shinji Tadenuma</a></span></span>.</p>
<p>
  <img src="https://developer.mbed.org/media/uploads/simon/flyers.jpg" alt="/media/uploads/simon/flyers.jpg"
  title="/media/uploads/simon/flyers.jpg">
</p>
<p>It has 2.4inch TFT color screen with Japanese characters font and socket
  for Xbee. Now we have even more options for mbed baseboards.</p>
<p>Some shops were selling mbed, baseboard, and mbed based kits like Geiger
  counters and the robot:Wallbot designed by <span><span class="authortext"><a href="/users/jksoft913/"><img alt="" class="icon" src="data:image/jpeg;base64,"></a> <a href="/users/jksoft913/"> Junichi Katsu</a></span></span>;</p>
<div
class="flex-video">
  <iframe width="420" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/1FDBYwRouxE"
  frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe>
  </div>
  <p>Summary: the mbed community in Japan is growing so strongly!&quot;</p>
  <p>Thanks <span><span class="authortext"><a href="/users/okano/"><img alt="" class="icon" src="data:image/jpeg;base64,"></a> <a href="/users/okano/"> Tedd OKANO</a></span></span>!</p>
